review_blob: Excelleny IPA.  Very crispy hop flavor.  Sweet enough to cover the alcohol.  Smooth enough to enjoy and a great finish that you can enjoy.
Really good IPA from FF.  Its got a fruity finish to it and is decently bitter.  All hop heads should give this one a try.
beer_name: Flying Fish HopFish India Pale Ale

review_blob: Actually a decent beer for FF.  Very refreshing for a lighter beer and has a bit of noticible hops.  Its also kind of sweet and smooth.
Its a decent Belgian style brew.  Not too heavy either.  Its not too bad for a local (for me) beer
Had a bottle of the winter 06/07 version.  It is really dark, smooth, chocolaty and bit malty with a hint of coffee.  Very nice brew with a good kick!!!!!
Had this on tap at their brew pub in Gettysburg.  Its pretty good and a little hoppier than their Hoppy Trails.  Would definately recommend to an IPA lover
This is a great IPA.  Full of citrus hops with a smooth body.  Tried this brew because the distributor said I wouldnt be dissapointed, and I wasnt.
Had this on tap at ABCs Gettysburg brew pub.  Has a malty taste to it that sticks around for a while as the slight hop taste fads away.  But the hops makes it drinkable for me
Had this at ABCs Gettysburg bre pub.  Has the taste of a pilsner, but its got some hops added to it.  Im not a big pilsner fan, but the hops in this brew does it for me

Had a 12 oz bottle of this.  Its a hoppy ale thats pretty strong, but well balanced.  There is no noticible alcohol to this, but itll sneak up on you after a few.  With this beer, they are well on their way to making a nice double IPA.
This is a great, well balanced IPA.  Its like a toned-down version of the 90 Minute.  I love the 90 Minute more and this beer is like its little brother
A decent simple coffee stout, in my opinion.  Had it on tap at their brew pub in Gettysburg.
Nice smooth chocolate porter.  Had it on tap at their brew pub in Gettysburg.  Maybe a little thin, but definately smooth and drinkable
Pretty good porter.  Definately has a roasted chocolate taste and somewhat smooth for my taste

This is one high octane 2xIPA.  Just had it on tap and after 3, I was done.  Its super hoppy and high alcohol.  So high that its noticible.  If it were a 9% alcohol, it would probably be better.  But, dont let that scare you away from it.  Found it at my local distributor for $40/case
Just came in at the distributor last week.  Nice floral hoppy IPA, (2xIPA to me).  Bought a case for $30, and dist. also has 1/6 kegs.  A definite "must have" for the serious IPA drinker!!!!
Had a bottle from 2003 (aged it 2 years).  Still pretty potent, but a little bitter.  Not a very hoppy barleywine but still pretty good
This is one hoppin IPA.  Its like HopDevil times 2.  Citric hops are all over this brew (You can even see them)  After a few of these, I looked about as drunk and happy as the guy on the label.
Great IPA by Victory.  Hoppy aroma, hoppy taste, slightly dark amber color.  Nice hoppy/malty finish.  Good in both bottles and on tap
ABC,s Gettysburg brew pub had a cask of this on tap last week.   Malt stood out more than the hops.  Also had the regular stuff.  It was pretty simple for my taste
This is one of ABCs hoppist beers (Barleywine is close to it by IBUs).  Has a nice amber color, is also nicely balanced with a hoppy aroma and kind of a citric finish.
On tap at ABCs Gettysburg brew pub.  Deep red color, a bit hoppy (around 40 some IBUs if I remember right).  This version was around 12% (again, if I remember correctly).  Had about 4 or 5 of them.
A good hoppy ale (Id call it an IPA).  Had this on tap at home last summer and loved it.  It poured a slightly dark amber color with a slightly hoppy aroma.  Its also very well balanced.
A slightly hoppy pilsner (is there such a thing?)  Im not a big pilsner fan, but this one does it for me.
Nice dark brown color, not very heavy in taste, but can taste the chocolate.  A nice porter by Weyerbacher.
This is a nice sweet hoppy IPA.  Not very bitter, but full of taste.  Well balanced and very drinkable.  Had this on tap at home last summer (1/6 keg).
I think this is the best beer made by Shipyard.  Its also the hardest one to find (for me).  Has a decent amount of hops for a pale ale and has a slight bitterness, but is balanced.

Had this on tap and was disappointed.  Very simple.  Had a hard time finding hops.  Color was light (that may have set the tone for me).  I wouldnt call it a swill, but it sure fits into my "lawnmower" catagory
I think that (for me) this is the quad of quads.  Very smooth, well balanced, complex.  12 oz bottle that I had sitting in the cold cellar for about 2 to 3 years.
This is the closest thing Ive had to a LaTrappe Quad (my favorite abbey quad).  This is a little more bitter than LaTrappe, otherwise very, very good.
I liked the Blithering Idiot, so I expected this to be just as good.  Definately has the smooth whiskey touch.   I could just sit in front of the fire, on a snowy nite, and sip this all nite.
So far, this is the best stout Ive tried.  Super, super smooth.  Chocolate accents and very well balanced.  Had no idea it was 9%
beer_name: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Its a pumpkin pie in a bottle!!!!!  I have to agree with Degarth; Im not a fan either.  All the spices are too much for me.  This beer scared me away from all the "pumpkin beers"
This is a super 2xIPA!!!!!  I was in hop heaven.  Its super hoppy, super balanced and super drinkable!!!!!  Only problem is that my distributer cant keep enough in stock. (At $40/case, I wonder why?)
I didnt believe this was a barleywine after I first tried it.  Id describe it as a cross between a barleywine and an IPA.  The hops are definately present in this brew

Its a great 2xIPA that is dark clear amber colored beer.  Very hoppy and well balanced.  I had this on tap in my beermeister and it is so well balanced that, after 5 mugs, the alcohol sneeks up on you.
Good hoppy beer, but a little dry and bitter.  Has a good aroma and taste, but it could stand to be balanced a little better
beer_name: River Horse Hop Hazard Pale Ale

review_blob: Get a quick buzz for a cheap price (and a little skunk for free).  Definately a lawnmower beer.  But, for all of you swillheads, its better than Bud.
Great IPA.  This is my first Three Floyds beer.  Good hoppy aroma, great taste and after taste.  Balanced extremely well, couldnt taste the alcohol.
